block.p: Lori Ann Fedewa, the daughter of Linda M. Keysor of Harrison, Mich., and James L. Fedewa of Swartz Creek, Mich. was married yesterday to Peter Christensen Brodhead, a son of Mr. and Mrs. David C. Brodhead of New York. The Rev. Malcolm Davidson performed the ceremony at the Congregational Church in Warren, Conn.

Ms. Fedewa, 30, is keeping her name. She is a consultant in Greenwich, Conn., at Integrated HealthCare, consultants to the health care industry. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia University. Her father is a salesman at Skaff Carpet and Furniture in Flint, Mich. Her mother is a home-care nurse for the Mid-Michigan Regional Medical Center in Midland.

Lori Ann Fedewa, the daughter of Linda M. Keysor of Harrison, Mich., and James L. Fedewa of Swartz Creek, Mich. was married yesterday to Peter Christensen Brodhead, a son of Mr. and Mrs. David C. Brodhead of New York. The Rev. Malcolm Davidson performed the ceremony at the Congregational Church in Warren, Conn.

Ms. Fedewa, 30, is keeping her name. She is a consultant in Greenwich, Conn., at Integrated HealthCare, consultants to the health care industry. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia University. Her father is a salesman at Skaff Carpet and Furniture in Flint, Mich. Her mother is a home-care nurse for the Mid-Michigan Regional Medical Center in Midland.

Mr. Brodhead, 31, is an owner and a founder of Good Reason Expos and Tradeshows in New York. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown University. His mother, Nancie C. Brodhead, is a real estate broker in New York. His father is of counsel to Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, the New York law firm.
